document_metadata.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington’s Disease

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: Htt is involved in a variety of cellular functions including vesicle transport, transcription, and energy metabolism [1,2]. Deletion of the Htt gene in mouse results in embryonic lethality indicating that it is required for development [3].

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: Htt is involved in a variety of cellular functions including vesicle transport, transcription, and energy metabolism [1,2]. Deletion of the Htt gene in mouse results in embryonic lethality indicating that it is required for development [3].

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: Htt is involved in a variety of cellular functions including vesicle transport, transcription, and energy metabolism [1,2]. Deletion of the Htt gene in mouse results in embryonic lethality indicating that it is required for development [3].

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: Htt is involved in a variety of cellular functions including vesicle transport, transcription, and energy metabolism [1,2]. Deletion of the Htt gene in mouse results in embryonic lethality indicating that it is required for development [3].

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: A common downstream signaling pathway disrupted in HD is the extracellular signalregulated-kinase (ERK) pathway (also known as the mitogen-activated protein kinase or MAPK pathway) [8].

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: EGFR-induced ERK activation is disrupted in a Drosophila model of HD [10] and ERK activation is impaired after stimulation with EGF or NGF in PC12 cells expressing mutant huntingtin [11].

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: To evaluate potential therapeutic effects of pizotifen treatment in vivo , we measured motor function in HD transgenic R6/2 mice after treatment. Pizotifen (7.5 mg/kg or 10mg/kg) or saline was administered by daily IP injection starting at 6 weeks of age...The lack of effect on open-field behavior suggests that the improved rotarod performance is not simply due to acute effects on activity levels but instead to improved motor coordination.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: By immunohistochemistry (IHC), we found that levels of DARPP-32 in the striatum of the HD transgenic R6/2 mice were reduced at 10 weeks of age qualitatively. Pizotifen treatment increased DARPP-32 staining in the striatum at this time point (Figure 8 A ).

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: We evaluated several of the well-characterized receptors that are altered in HD including D2DR, GAD65/67, GluR2/3 and 5HT1B.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: D2DR, GAD65/67 and 5HT1B levels are also altered in the HD transgenic R6/2 mice, but pizotifen treatment did not normalize the levels (data not shown).

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: We evaluated several of the well-characterized receptors that are altered in HD including D2DR, GAD65/67, GluR2/3 and 5HT1B.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: The levels of mGluR2/3 in HD transgenic R6/2 mice at 10 weeks of age were slightly reduced and pizotifen treatment modestly increased levels of this receptor.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: The levels of mGluR2/3 in HD transgenic R6/2 mice at 10 weeks of age were slightly reduced and pizotifen treatment modestly increased levels of this receptor.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: We confirmed that the striatal area was reduced in the striatum of the HD transgenic R6/2 mice at 10 weeks of age and found that pizotifen treatment attenuated this reduction in striatal area (Figure 8 D ).

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: A common downstream signaling pathway disrupted in HD is the extracellular signalregulated-kinase (ERK) pathway (also known as the mitogen-activated protein kinase or MAPK pathway) [8].

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: EGFR-induced ERK activation is disrupted in a Drosophila model of HD [10] and ERK activation is impaired after stimulation with EGF or NGF in PC12 cells expressing mutant huntingtin [11].

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: BDNF-mediated ERK1/2 activation through the TrkB receptor is decreased in mutant Htt striatal cells and the reduction is associated with reduced survival. The alteration in signaling appears to be in part due to reduced expression of p52/p46 Sch docking proteins [9].

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: BDNF-mediated ERK1/2 activation through the TrkB receptor is decreased in mutant Htt striatal cells and the reduction is associated with reduced survival. The alteration in signaling appears to be in part due to reduced expression of p52/p46 Sch docking proteins [9].

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: BDNF-mediated ERK1/2 activation through the TrkB receptor is decreased in mutant Htt striatal cells and the reduction is associated with reduced survival. The alteration in signaling appears to be in part due to reduced expression of p52/p46 Sch docking proteins [9].

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: EGFR-induced ERK activation is disrupted in a Drosophila model of HD [10] and ERK activation is impaired after stimulation with EGF or NGF in PC12 cells expressing mutant huntingtin [11].

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: In the R6/2 mouse model of HD [21], treatment with pizotifen improved motor function, ameliorated neurodegeneration, restored striatal area, and increased ERK2 activation in the striatum.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: In the R6/2 mouse model of HD [21], treatment with pizotifen improved motor function, ameliorated neurodegeneration, restored striatal area, and increased ERK2 activation in the striatum.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: In the R6/2 mouse model of HD [21], treatment with pizotifen improved motor function, ameliorated neurodegeneration, restored striatal area, and increased ERK2 activation in the striatum.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: In the R6/2 mouse model of HD [21], treatment with pizotifen improved motor function, ameliorated neurodegeneration, restored striatal area, and increased ERK2 activation in the striatum.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: Mutant Htt causes the down-regulation of the dopamine- and cAMP-regulated 32-kDa phosphoprotein DARPP-32. DARPP-32 is involved in dopamine and serotonin signaling, is highly expressed in the striatum and prefrontal cortex and is a marker of neuronal dysfunction in HD mice [35,36].

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: BDNF-mediated ERK1/2 activation through the TrkB receptor is decreased in mutant Htt striatal cells and the reduction is associated with reduced survival. The alteration in signaling appears to be in part due to reduced expression of p52/p46 Sch docking proteins [9].

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: EGFR-induced ERK activation is disrupted in a Drosophila model of HD [10] and ERK activation is impaired after stimulation with EGF or NGF in PC12 cells expressing mutant huntingtin [11].

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: EGFR-induced ERK activation is disrupted in a Drosophila model of HD [10] and ERK activation is impaired after stimulation with EGF or NGF in PC12 cells expressing mutant huntingtin [11].

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: EGFR-induced ERK activation is disrupted in a Drosophila model of HD [10] and ERK activation is impaired after stimulation with EGF or NGF in PC12 cells expressing mutant huntingtin [11].

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: Examination of down-stream signaling events in ST Hdh Q111/Q111 cells treated with pizotifen showed that rescue of viability in these cells is dependent on transient activation of ERK1/2.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: Addition of pizotifen, cyproheptadine, or loxapine to the ST Hdh Q7/Q7 cells after serum withdrawal had no effect on ATP levels, indicating that the drugs do not have a general effect on viability but rather correct a deficit specific to the ST Hdh Q111/Q111 cells (Figure 2 A ).

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: Examination of down-stream signaling events in ST Hdh Q111/Q111 cells treated with pizotifen showed that rescue of viability in these cells is dependent on transient activation of ERK1/2.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: In the R6/2 mouse model of HD [21], treatment with pizotifen improved motor function, ameliorated neurodegeneration, restored striatal area, and increased ERK2 activation in the striatum.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: In the R6/2 mouse model of HD [21], treatment with pizotifen improved motor function, ameliorated neurodegeneration, restored striatal area, and increased ERK2 activation in the striatum.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: To evaluate potential therapeutic effects of pizotifen treatment in vivo , we measured motor function in HD transgenic R6/2 mice after treatment. Pizotifen (7.5 mg/kg or 10mg/kg) or saline was administered by daily IP injection starting at 6 weeks of age...The lack of effect on open-field behavior suggests that the improved rotarod performance is not simply due to acute effects on activity levels but instead to improved motor coordination.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: Taken together, results demonstrating that pizotifen can partially normalize levels of DARPP-32 while increasing striatal area indicate that the correction of motor deficits in the R6/2 mouse by pizotifen is likely due to neuroprotective effects of the drug.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: These results show that pizotifen can activate striatal ERK1/2 in vitro and in vivo, suggesting that the motor and neuropathological improvements observed in the R6/2 mouse may be mechanistically related to the rescue observed in the cell model.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: In the R6/2 mouse model of HD [21], treatment with pizotifen improved motor function, ameliorated neurodegeneration, restored striatal area, and increased ERK2 activation in the striatum.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: In the R6/2 mouse model of HD [21], treatment with pizotifen improved motor function, ameliorated neurodegeneration, restored striatal area, and increased ERK2 activation in the striatum.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: As shown in Figure 1 B , these drugs restored ATP levels in ST Hdh Q111/Q111 cells after serum withdrawal in a dose-dependent manner.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: Addition of pizotifen, cyproheptadine, or loxapine to the ST Hdh Q7/Q7 cells after serum withdrawal had no effect on ATP levels, indicating that the drugs do not have a general effect on viability but rather correct a deficit specific to the ST Hdh Q111/Q111 cells (Figure 2 A ).

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: Caspase activation in the ST Hdh Q111/Q111 cells was significantly blocked by the addition of the pizotifen, cyproheptadine, or loxapine in a dose-dependent manner (Figure 1 D , compound structures 1E).

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: Caspase activation in the ST Hdh Q111/Q111 cells was significantly blocked by the addition of the pizotifen, cyproheptadine, or loxapine in a dose-dependent manner (Figure 1 D , compound structures 1E).

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: A significant increase in the phosphorylation of ERK1 (p44) occurred after a 15-min treatment with pizotifen, cyproheptadine, or loxapine in both ST Hdh Q111/Q111 and ST Hdh Q7/Q7 cells (Figure 3 A ).

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: Interestingly, western blotting analysis showed that the levels of phospho-ERK1 (p44) are significantly reduced in the cortex of the HD transgenic R6/2 mice at 10 weeks of age with pizotifen treatment (Figure 10 B ).

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: The lower levels of phospho-ERK1 (p44) in the cortex may reflect distinct signaling pathways in these two regions of the brain in response to pizotifen.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: A significant increase in phospho-ERK2 (p42) occurred after treatment with pizotifen and loxapine and an upward trend occurred after treatment with cyproheptadine in ST Hdh Q111/Q111cells. Pizotifen treatment significantly increased phospho-ERK2 in ST Hdh Q7/Q7 cells (Figure 3B).

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: At 10 weeks of age, we observed that levels of activated ERK2 (p42) were increased in the striatum of the pizotifen-treated HD transgenic R6/2 mice both by IHC and western blotting (Figure 10 A, C).

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: We measured the time-course of pizotifen-induced ERK activation under conditions of serum withdrawal in ST Hdh Q111/Q111 cells and found significant increases in phosphoERK1/2 after five and fifteen minutes of treatment (Figure 3 C,D).

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: PhosphoERK1/2 levels in DMSO control cells increased slowly with time and were approximately equal between pizotifen and control cells after 24 hours of treatment.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: These results show that pizotifen can activate striatal ERK1/2 in vitro and in vivo, suggesting that the motor and neuropathological improvements observed in the R6/2 mouse may be mechanistically related to the rescue observed in the cell model.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: We measured the time-course of pizotifen-induced ERK activation under conditions of serum withdrawal in ST Hdh Q111/Q111 cells and found significant increases in phosphoERK1/2 after five and fifteen minutes of treatment (Figure 3 C,D).

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: PhosphoERK1/2 levels in DMSO control cells increased slowly with time and were approximately equal between pizotifen and control cells after 24 hours of treatment.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: These results show that pizotifen can activate striatal ERK1/2 in vitro and in vivo, suggesting that the motor and neuropathological improvements observed in the R6/2 mouse may be mechanistically related to the rescue observed in the cell model.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: Pizotifen is a serotonin antagonist used to treat recurrent migraine [22]. It binds to over 30 receptors, including subtypes of the serotonin, dopamine, histamine, adrenoreceptor, and cholinergic receptors (for binding profile, see Young et. al. [19])

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: Pizotifen is a serotonin antagonist used to treat recurrent migraine [22]. It binds to over 30 receptors, including subtypes of the serotonin, dopamine, histamine, adrenoreceptor, and cholinergic receptors (for binding profile, see Young et. al. [19])

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: In addition, pizotifen has been shown to be a partial agonist of the 5-HT1A receptor. Agonism was reportedly blocked by the 5-HT1A antagonist WAY-100,635 [23]. WAY-100,635 also blocks the activation of ERK by several antipsychotic drugs that are agonists of the 5-HT1A receptor, as well as the activation of ERK through the 5-HT1A endogenous ligand serotonin [24].

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: By immunohistochemistry (IHC), we found that levels of DARPP-32 in the striatum of the HD transgenic R6/2 mice were reduced at 10 weeks of age qualitatively. Pizotifen treatment increased DARPP-32 staining in the striatum at this time point (Figure 8 A ).

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: At 12-weeks of age, the pizotifen treatment resulted in a statistically significant increase in striatal DARPP-32 levels when compared to untreated R6/2 controls (Figure 8C).

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: Taken together, results demonstrating that pizotifen can partially normalize levels of DARPP-32 while increasing striatal area indicate that the correction of motor deficits in the R6/2 mouse by pizotifen is likely due to neuroprotective effects of the drug.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: The levels of mGluR2/3 in HD transgenic R6/2 mice at 10 weeks of age were slightly reduced and pizotifen treatment modestly increased levels of this receptor.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: The levels of mGluR2/3 in HD transgenic R6/2 mice at 10 weeks of age were slightly reduced and pizotifen treatment modestly increased levels of this receptor.

links.evidence: D2DR, GAD65/67 and 5HT1B levels are also altered in the HD transgenic R6/2 mice, but pizotifen treatment did not normalize the levels (data not shown).

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: We did not detect any changes in the levels of Htt protein or localization in the R6/2 mouse model suggesting that the mechanism is not mediated through clearance pathways (Figure 9, and data not shown).

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: These results show that pizotifen can activate striatal ERK1/2 in vitro and in vivo, suggesting that the motor and neuropathological improvements observed in the R6/2 mouse may be mechanistically related to the rescue observed in the cell model.

links.evidence: A significant increase in phospho-ERK2 (p42) occurred after treatment with pizotifen and loxapine and an upward trend occurred after treatment with cyproheptadine in ST Hdh Q111/Q111cells. Pizotifen treatment significantly increased phospho-ERK2 in ST Hdh Q7/Q7 cells (Figure 3B).

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: The activated ERK by IHC was demonstrated by an increased number of neurons staining positive for phospho-ERK qualitatively (Figure 10C).

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: The activated ERK by IHC was demonstrated by an increased number of neurons staining positive for phospho-ERK qualitatively (Figure 10C).

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: PhosphoERK1/2 levels in DMSO control cells increased slowly with time and were approximately equal between pizotifen and control cells after 24 hours of treatment.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: PhosphoERK1/2 levels in DMSO control cells increased slowly with time and were approximately equal between pizotifen and control cells after 24 hours of treatment.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: To determine if transient pizotifen-induced ERK phosphorylation is necessary for rescue of mutant Htt toxicity, we blocked ERK phosphorylation by co-treatment with MEK1/2 inhibitor U0126.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: Inhibiting ERK1/2 phosphorylation in the presence of pizotifen prevented the rescue of ST Hdh Q111/Q111 cells in the ATP assay (Figure 4 C ).

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: In addition, pizotifen has been shown to be a partial agonist of the 5-HT1A receptor. Agonism was reportedly blocked by the 5-HT1A antagonist WAY-100,635 [23]. WAY-100,635 also blocks the activation of ERK by several antipsychotic drugs that are agonists of the 5-HT1A receptor, as well as the activation of ERK through the 5-HT1A endogenous ligand serotonin [24].

links.evidence: In addition, pizotifen has been shown to be a partial agonist of the 5-HT1A receptor. Agonism was reportedly blocked by the 5-HT1A antagonist WAY-100,635 [23]. WAY-100,635 also blocks the activation of ERK by several antipsychotic drugs that are agonists of the 5-HT1A receptor, as well as the activation of ERK through the 5-HT1A endogenous ligand serotonin [24].

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: Another 5-HT1A antagonist, NAD-299, exhibits a pharmacological profile similar to WAY-100,635 [25], with both WAY-100,635 and NAD-299 showing high selectivity for the 5-HT1A receptor (binding it with nanomolar affinities).

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: To determine if we had overlooked other active compounds from the Prestwick library, we retested risperidone, metergoline, ketanserin, spiperone, and promethazine. These drugs have overlapping targets with pizotifen and are known to act through serotonin receptors [20, 27, 28, 29, 30, 31, 32, 33].

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: One drug, promethazine, rescued ST Hdh Q111/Q111 cells (Figure 5). Promethazine is also a high affinity antagonist of the H1 receptor and has previously been reported to rescue an HD model [34].

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: Cetirizine, diphenhydramine, ketotifen, desloratadine, and chlorphreniramine failed to rescue ST Hdh Q111/Q111 cells (Figure 6). This suggests that the activity of the drugs in the cell-based assay is not related solely to their common ability to block the H1 receptor.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: Mutant Htt causes the down-regulation of the dopamine- and cAMP-regulated 32-kDa phosphoprotein DARPP-32. DARPP-32 is involved in dopamine and serotonin signaling, is highly expressed in the striatum and prefrontal cortex and is a marker of neuronal dysfunction in HD mice [35,36].

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: We evaluated several of the well-characterized receptors that are altered in HD including D2DR, GAD65/67, GluR2/3 and 5HT1B.

citation.name: Pizotifen Activates ERK and Provides Neuroprotection in vitro and in vivo in Models of Huntington's Disease.

links.evidence: D2DR, GAD65/67 and 5HT1B levels are also altered in the HD transgenic R6/2 mice, but pizotifen treatment did not normalize the levels (data not shown).
